transcript:
and he felt afraid- afraid not for his life, but for the courage he needed and which he knew would not stand the sight of these unfortunates. 
The French, who had ceased firing at this field strewn with dead and wounded where there was no one left to fire at, on seeing an adjutant riding over it trained a gun on him and fired several shots. The sensation of those terrible whistling sounds and of the corpses around him merged in Rost6v's mind into a single feeling of terror and pity for himse
